Package com.marklogic.mule.extension.connector.internal.operation

Class MarkLogicOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marklogic.mule.extension.connector.internal.operation.MarkLogicOperations
  • public class MarkLogicOperations
extends Object
    This class is a container for operations, every public method in this class will be taken as an extension operation for the MarkLogic MuleSoft Connector
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.1.2
    Author:
    Jonathan Krebs (jkrebs), Clay Redding (wattsferry), John Shingler (jshingler)
    See Also:
    MarkLogic MuleSoft Connector GitHub

      Delete query-selected document content asynchronously from MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API Data Movement SDK (DMSDK) returning a JSON object detailing the outcome.

      Loads JSON, XML, text, or binary document content asynchronously into MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API Data Movement SDK (DMSDK) returning the DMSDK JobTicket ID used to insert the contents into MarkLogic.

    • Method Detail

      • importDocs

        @MediaType(value="application/json",
           strict=true)
@Throws(MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider.class)
public InputStream importDocs​(@Config
                              MarkLogicConfiguration markLogicConfiguration,
                              @Connection
                              MarkLogicConnection connection,
                              @DisplayName("Document payload") @Summary("The content of the input files to be used for ingestion into MarkLogic.") @Example("#[payload]") @Content
                              InputStream docPayloads,
                              @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Summary("A comma-separated list of output collections used during ingestion.") @Example("mulesoft-test")
                              String outputCollections,
                              @Optional(defaultValue="rest-reader,read,rest-writer,update") @Summary("A comma-separated list of roles and capabilities used during ingestion.") @Example("myRole,read,myRole,update")
                              String outputPermissions,
                              @Optional(defaultValue="1") @Summary("A number indicating the quality of the persisted documents.") @Example("1")
                              int outputQuality,
                              @Optional(defaultValue="/") @Summary("The URI prefix, used to prepend and concatenate basenameUri.") @Example("/mulesoft/")
                              String outputUriPrefix,
                              @Optional(defaultValue="") @Summary("The URI suffix, used to append and concatenate basenameUri.") @Example(".json")
                              String outputUriSuffix,
                              @DisplayName("Generate output URI basename?") @Optional(defaultValue="true") @Summary("Creates a document basename based on an auto-generated UUID.") @Example("false")
                              boolean generateOutputUriBasename,
                              @DisplayName("Output document basename") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Summary("File basename to be used for persistence in MarkLogic, usually payload-derived.") @Example("employee123.json")
                              String basenameUri,
                              @DisplayName("Temporal collection") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Summary("The temporal collection imported documents will be loaded into.") @Example("myTemporalCollection")
                              String temporalCollection,
                              @Summary("The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("ml:sjsInputFlow")
                              String serverTransform,
                              @Summary("A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("entity-name,MyEntity,flow-name,loadMyEntity")
                              String serverTransformParams)

        Loads JSON, XML, text, or binary document content asynchronously into MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API Data Movement SDK (DMSDK) returning the DMSDK JobTicket ID used to insert the contents into MarkLogic.

        Parameters:
        markLogicConfiguration - The MarkLogic configuration details
        connection - The MarkLogic connection details
        docPayloads - The content of the input files to be used for ingestion into MarkLogic.
        outputCollections - A comma-separated list of output collections used during ingestion.
        outputPermissions - A comma-separated list of roles and capabilities used during ingestion.
        outputQuality - A number indicating the quality of the persisted documents.
        outputUriPrefix - The URI prefix, used to prepend and concatenate basenameUri.
        outputUriSuffix - The URI suffix, used to append and concatenate basenameUri.
        generateOutputUriBasename - Creates a document basename based on an auto-generated UUID.
        basenameUri - File basename to be used for persistence in MarkLogic, usually payload-derived.
        temporalCollection - The temporal collection imported documents will be loaded into.
        serverTransform - The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.
        serverTransformParams - A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.
        Returns:
        java.io.InputStream
        Throws:
        MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getJobReport

        @Deprecated
@MediaType(value="application/json",
           strict=true)
@DisplayName("Get Job Report (deprecated)")
public InputStream getJobReport()
        Deprecated.
        Deprecated in v.1.1.1

        Retrieves a JSON representation of a MarkLogic Java API Data Movement SDK (DMSDK) JobReport following an importDocs operation.

        Returns:
        java.io.InputStream
        Throws:
        MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider
        Since:
        1.0.0

        @MediaType(value="*/*",
           strict=false)
public String retrieveInfo​(@Config
                           MarkLogicConfiguration configuration,
                           @Connection
                           MarkLogicConnection connection)

        Echoes the current MarkLogicConnector and MarkLogicConfiguration information.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The MarkLogic configuration details
        connection - The MarkLogic connection details
        Returns:
        java.lang.String
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • deleteDocs

        @MediaType(value="application/json",
           strict=true)
@Throws(MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider.class)
public InputStream deleteDocs​(@Config
                              MarkLogicConfiguration configuration,
                              @Connection
                              MarkLogicConnection connection,
                              @DisplayName("Serialized Query String") @Summary("The serialized query XML or JSON.") @Text
                              String queryString,
                              @DisplayName("Search API Options") @Optional @Summary("The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.")
                              String optionsName,
                              @DisplayName("Search Strategy") @Summary("The Java class used to execute the serialized query.")
                              MarkLogicQueryStrategy queryStrategy,
                              @DisplayName("Use Consistent Snapshot") @Summary("Whether to use a consistent point-in-time snapshot for operations.")
                              boolean useConsistentSnapshot,
                              @DisplayName("Serialized Query Format") @Summary("The format of the serialized query.")
                              MarkLogicQueryFormat fmt)

        Delete query-selected document content asynchronously from MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API Data Movement SDK (DMSDK) returning a JSON object detailing the outcome.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The MarkLogic configuration details
        connection - The MarkLogic connection details
        queryString - The serialized query XML or JSON.
        optionsName - The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.
        queryStrategy - The Java class used to execute the serialized query.
        useConsistentSnapshot - Whether to use a consistent point-in-time snapshot for operations.
        fmt - The format of the serialized query.
        Returns:
        java.io.InputStream
        Throws:
        MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • selectDocsByStructuredQuery

        @Deprecated
@MediaType(value="*/*",
           strict=false)
@OutputResolver(output=MarkLogicSelectMetadataResolver.class)
@DisplayName("Select Documents By Structured Query (deprecated)")
@Throws(MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider.class)
public org.mule.runtime.extension.api.runtime.streaming.PagingProvider<MarkLogicConnection,​Object> selectDocsByStructuredQuery​(@Config
                                                                                                                                     MarkLogicConfiguration configuration,
                                                                                                                                     @DisplayName("Serialized Query String") @Summary("The serialized query XML or JSON.") @Text
                                                                                                                                     String structuredQuery,
                                                                                                                                     @DisplayName("Search API Options") @Optional @Summary("The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.")
                                                                                                                                     String optionsName,
                                                                                                                                     @DisplayName("Search Strategy") @Summary("The Java class used to execute the serialized query.")
                                                                                                                                     MarkLogicQueryStrategy structuredQueryStrategy,
                                                                                                                                     @DisplayName("Serialized Query Format") @Summary("The format of the serialized query.")
                                                                                                                                     MarkLogicQueryFormat fmt,
                                                                                                                                     @Summary("The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("ml:sjsInputFlow")
                                                                                                                                     String serverTransform,
                                                                                                                                     @Summary("A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("entity-name,MyEntity,flow-name,loadMyEntity")
                                                                                                                                     String serverTransformParams)
        Deprecated.
        Deprecated in v.1.1.0, use queryDocs instead

        Retrieve query-selected document content synchronously from MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The MarkLogic configuration details
        structuredQuery - The serialized query XML or JSON.
        optionsName - The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.
        structuredQueryStrategy - The Java class used to execute the serialized query
        fmt - The format of the serialized query.
        serverTransform - The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.
        serverTransformParams - A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.
        streamingHelper - The streaming helper.
        Returns:
        org.mule.runtime.extension.api.runtime.streaming.PagingProvider
        Throws:
        MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • queryDocs

        @MediaType(value="*/*",
           strict=false)
@OutputResolver(output=MarkLogicAnyMetadataResolver.class)
@Throws(MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider.class)
public org.mule.runtime.extension.api.runtime.streaming.PagingProvider<MarkLogicConnection,​Object> queryDocs​(@Config
                                                                                                                   MarkLogicConfiguration configuration,
                                                                                                                   @DisplayName("Serialized Query String") @Summary("The serialized query XML or JSON.") @Text
                                                                                                                   String queryString,
                                                                                                                   @DisplayName("Search API Options") @Optional @Summary("The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.")
                                                                                                                   String optionsName,
                                                                                                                   @DisplayName("Page Length") @Optional @Summary("Number of documents fetched at a time, defaults to the connection batch size.")
                                                                                                                   Integer pageLength,
                                                                                                                   @DisplayName("Maximum Number of Results") @Optional @Summary("Maximum total number of documents to be fetched, defaults to unlimited.")
                                                                                                                   Long maxResults,
                                                                                                                   @DisplayName("Search Strategy") @Summary("The Java class used to execute the serialized query.")
                                                                                                                   MarkLogicQueryStrategy queryStrategy,
                                                                                                                   @DisplayName("Serialized Query Format") @Summary("The format of the serialized query.")
                                                                                                                   MarkLogicQueryFormat fmt,
                                                                                                                   @Summary("The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("ml:sjsInputFlow")
                                                                                                                   String serverTransform,
                                                                                                                   @Summary("A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("entity-name,MyEntity,flow-name,loadMyEntity")
                                                                                                                   String serverTransformParams)

        Retrieve query-selected document content synchronously from MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API.

        Parameters:
        configuration - The MarkLogic configuration details
        queryString - The serialized query XML or JSON.
        optionsName - The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.
        pageLength - Number of documents fetched at a time, defaults to the connection batch size.
        maxResults - Maximum total number of documents to be fetched, defaults to unlimited.
        queryStrategy - The Java class used to execute the serialized query
        fmt - The format of the serialized query.
        serverTransform - The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.
        serverTransformParams - A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.
        Returns:
        org.mule.runtime.extension.api.runtime.streaming.PagingProvider
        Throws:
        MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • exportDocs

        @MediaType(value="*/*",
           strict=false)
@OutputResolver(output=MarkLogicAnyMetadataResolver.class)
@Throws(MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider.class)
public org.mule.runtime.extension.api.runtime.streaming.PagingProvider<MarkLogicConnection,​Object> exportDocs​(@Config
                                                                                                                    MarkLogicConfiguration configuration,
                                                                                                                    @DisplayName("Serialized Query String") @Summary("The serialized query XML or JSON.") @Text
                                                                                                                    String queryString,
                                                                                                                    @DisplayName("Search API Options") @Optional @Summary("The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.")
                                                                                                                    String optionsName,
                                                                                                                    @DisplayName("Search Strategy") @Summary("The Java class used to execute the serialized query.")
                                                                                                                    MarkLogicQueryStrategy queryStrategy,
                                                                                                                    @DisplayName("Serialized Query Format") @Summary("The format of the serialized query.")
                                                                                                                    MarkLogicQueryFormat fmt,
                                                                                                                    @DisplayName("Maximum Number of Results") @Optional @Summary("Maximum total number of documents to be fetched, defaults to unlimited.")
                                                                                                                    Long maxResults,
                                                                                                                    @DisplayName("Use Consistent Snapshot") @Summary("Whether to use a consistent point-in-time snapshot for operations.")
                                                                                                                    boolean useConsistentSnapshot,
                                                                                                                    @Summary("The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("ml:sjsInputFlow")
                                                                                                                    String serverTransform,
                                                                                                                    @Summary("A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.") @Optional(defaultValue="null") @Example("entity-name,MyEntity,flow-name,loadMyEntity")
                                                                                                                    String serverTransformParams)

        Retrieve query-selected document content asynchronously from MarkLogic, via the MarkLogic Java API Data Movement SDK (DMSDK).

        Parameters:
        configuration - The MarkLogic configuration details
        queryString - The serialized query XML or JSON.
        optionsName - The server-side Search API options file used to configure the search.
        queryStrategy - The Java class used to execute the serialized query.
        fmt - The format of the serialized query.
        maxResults - Maximum total number of documents to be fetched, defaults to unlimited.
        useConsistentSnapshot - Whether to use a consistent point-in-time snapshot for operations.
        serverTransform - The name of a deployed MarkLogic server-side Javascript, XQuery, or XSLT.
        serverTransformParams - A comma-separated list of alternating transform parameter names and values.
        Returns:
        org.mule.runtime.extension.api.runtime.streaming.PagingProvider
        Throws:
        MarkLogicExecuteErrorsProvider
        Since:
        1.1.0
